split.title: Choose Your Training Split
split.description: Select how you want to organize your training week. This determines how muscle groups are distributed across workouts.

push_pull_legs.name: Push / Pull / Legs
push_pull_legs.description: Separate pushing, pulling, and leg movements across different days. Ideal for balanced development and high frequency.

upper_lower.name: Upper / Lower
upper_lower.description: Alternate between upper body and lower body workouts. Great for strength and balanced recovery.

full_body.name: Full Body
full_body.description: Train all major muscle groups each session. Perfect for beginners or those with limited training days.

custom.name: Custom Split
custom.description: Let the AI create a customized split based on your preferences and training approach.

split.frequencyLabel: How many days per week can you train?
split.frequencyDescription: This helps us optimize your split and volume distribution.

recommendations.label: Recommendation:
recommendations.low: Full Body split is ideal for 2 or fewer training days per week.
recommendations.three: Push/Pull/Legs or Full Body work well with 3 days per week.
recommendations.medium: Upper/Lower or Push/Pull/Legs provide optimal frequency and recovery.
recommendations.high: Push/Pull/Legs allows high frequency training with adequate recovery.

equipment.title: Equipment Preferences

weakPoints.title: Identify Your Weak Points

weakPoints.optionalNote: This is optional - you can skip if you don't have specific weak points.

bottomNote.text: Training approaches are implemented as complete knowledge bases, not hardcoded rules. AI agents query these knowledge engines to make decisions with full methodological fidelity.

footer.text: The system learns from your behavior and protects you automatically.

subtitle.main: Write naturally. AI extracts insights, preferences, and patterns automatically.
subtitle.tagline: Zero manual tagging. Just honest feedback.

step1.title: 1. You Write
step1.exampleNote: "Felt amazing on squats today, could've pushed heavier. Shoulder still bothering me on overhead press though. Might stick to landmine press for a while."
step1.footer: ‚úçÔ∏è Just your honest feedback, no structured format required

step3.title: 3. Auto-Adapts
step3.avoided: Avoided due to shoulder pain insight

realExample.title: Real-World Example: Multi-Entity Extraction
realExample.description: One note, multiple insights extracted simultaneously
realExample.inputNote: "Lower back felt tight after deadlifts, might need to deload next week. Cable rows felt phenomenal though, definitely prefer them over barbell rows. Mental readiness was low today (2/5), probably overtrained shoulders this week."
realExample.contextText: Timestamps, exercise names, load used, and RIR from the workout are automatically attached to each insight. The AI doesn't just parse text‚Äîit understands workout context.

footer.text: Write like you'd text a coach: "shoulder hurts", "loved this", "felt weak". The Pattern Scout agent handles extraction, confidence scoring, and automatic application. You just write honestly.

gymReady.subtitle: Not another app that fails when you need it most. Designed for real training environments.

wakeLock.title: Wake Lock
wakeLock.detail: No more unlocking your phone between sets. Screen stays active with Wake Lock API.

offlineSupport.title: Offline Support
offlineSupport.detail: All AI decisions run client-side. Full functionality without connectivity. Auto-sync when back online.

crashRecovery.title: Crash Recovery
crashRecovery.detail: localStorage persistence after every set. App crashes? Phone dies? Your workout is safe.

customEquipment.title: Custom Equipment
customEquipment.detail: Got a specialty machine? Custom cable attachment? Add it once, AI suggests exercises for it forever.

codeExample.title: Crash Recovery - localStorage Persistence

results.batteryDies: Phone battery dies mid-workout ‚Üí Resume exactly where you left
results.appCrash: App crashes during heavy set ‚Üí No data lost

scenario.label: Real-world scenario:
scenario.text: You're mid-squat set, phone battery hits 1%, dies. Charge it, open app ‚Üí "Resume workout from Set 3?" Everything restored.

gymReady.footer: These features aren't marketing bullet points. They're in production, battle-tested in real gyms with spotty WiFi and dying phones.

comparison.subtitle: No marketing claims. Just feature-by-feature comparison.

card.title: Feature Comparison
card.description: Arvo vs alternatives you're probably considering

bottomNote.label: The reality:
bottomNote.text: Excel gives you full control but zero intelligence. Generic apps track sets but don't understand progression. PTs are great but expensive and unavailable 24/7. Arvo combines AI reasoning with always-on availability at zero cost.

faq.title: Questions?
faq.subtitle: The 6 questions everyone asks before trying a new training app.

offline.question: Does it work offline in the gym?
offline.answer: Yes, completely. All AI decisions run locally with cached models. No internet required during workouts. Data syncs automatically when you're back online. Wake Lock keeps screen on, so you never have to unlock your phone between sets.

customEquipment.question: Can I add my own custom equipment?
customEquipment.answer: Absolutely. Got a specialty machine your gym has? Custom cable attachment? Add it once with a name and example exercises. The AI will suggest exercises for your custom equipment in future workouts. It's in the equipment database permanently.

injury.question: What if I get injured or have pain?
injury.answer: The Insights system automatically detects patterns. Log pain once on French Press? It notes it. Twice? Creates an insight with severity level. Three times? Automatically avoids that exercise and suggests alternatives. Every AI agent reads active insights and adapts decisions accordingly. Zero configuration required.

learning.question: How does the AI learn my preferences?
learning.answer: Three ways: 1) Pattern detection (you substitute Exercise A with B 3+ times ‚Üí learns preference), 2) Notes extraction (write 'loved this exercise' at end of workout ‚Üí creates positive memory with NLP), 3) Behavioral signals (consistently high mental readiness on certain movements ‚Üí confidence boost). All automatic, zero manual tagging. Just write honest feedback and the Pattern Scout agent extracts insights.

vsExcel.question: How is this different from an Excel spreadsheet?
vsExcel.answer: Excel gives you control but zero intelligence. You manually calculate next weight, track volume, decide when to deload. Arvo automates all of it with AI reasoning: set-by-set progression suggestions in <500ms, volume tracking vs MEV/MAV/MRV, automatic deload triggers, biomechanical weight adjustments for exercise swaps, pattern learning from your preferences. Excel is static. Arvo adapts.

dataOwnership.question: Is my training data mine? Can I export it?
dataOwnership.answer: 100% yours. Export anytime to JSON/CSV. Privacy-first design: no data selling, no third-party analytics tracking your workouts. Your training history belongs to you. Supabase backend with row-level security. You own your data completely.

pricing.question: How much does it cost?
pricing.answer: Free to start. Passwordless magic link authentication, no credit card required. Core features (AI workout generation, progression tracking, insights, custom equipment) are available immediately. The goal is to make intelligent training accessible, not to gatekeep behind paywalls.

volumeTracking.subtitle: Never overtrain. Never undertrain. Automatic tracking vs scientific landmarks.

deloadCard.title: Automatic Deload Triggers
deloadCard.description: System detects fatigue patterns and suggests deloads before you overtrain

noProgress.example: Bench press stuck at 100kg √ó 10 for 3 workouts

intelligentPrevention.title: Intelligent prevention:
intelligentPrevention.description: The system tracks progress stalls, mental readiness trends, and volume accumulation. When multiple biomarkers suggest fatigue, it recommends a deload before performance degrades.

comparisonNote.text: Generic apps count sets but don't understand MEV/MAV/MRV. Arvo tracks scientifically validated volume landmarks per muscle group and warns you before overtraining.

biomechanics.subtitle: Exercise substitutions with automatic weight adjustments based on biomechanics.

codeExample.title: Movement Adapter - Weight Calculation
codeExample.description: Biomechanical intelligence for exercise swaps ¬∑ AI Agent

proTip.label: Pro tip:
proTip.text: The system also validates if the substitution maintains workout intent. "Approved" means same stimulus-to-fatigue profile. "Caution" means different stimulus (with explanation).

medicalDisclaimer.title: Medical Disclaimer

onboarding.description: Before we generate your first AI-powered workout, please read this important safety information.
onboarding.emphasis: AI-generated workouts are educational tools, not medical advice or professional coaching.

medicalDisclaimer.consultProfessional: Always consult with a qualified healthcare professional before starting any exercise program.

aiCannot.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è AI Cannot:
items: Provide medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment

stopExercise.title: üö® Stop Exercise and Seek Medical Help If You Experience:
items: Chest pain, pressure, or difficulty breathing
Severe dizziness or loss of consciousness

responsibilities.title: ‚úÖ Your Responsibilities:
items: Obtain medical clearance before exercising (if needed)
Provide accurate information about your health and limitations
Stop if you experience pain, discomfort, or unusual symptoms
Critically evaluate AI recommendations using your own judgment

assumptionOfRisk.title: ‚öñÔ∏è Assumption of Risk:
assumptionOfRisk.description: Exercise involves inherent risks including muscle strains, joint injuries, cardiovascular events, and in rare cases, serious injury or death. By using Arvo, you voluntarily assume all risks associated with exercise and physical training.

medicalDisclaimer.consent: I have read and understood this medical disclaimer. I acknowledge that Arvo is not medical advice, that AI can make mistakes, and that I am solely responsible for my safety and health. I agree to consult healthcare professionals when appropriate.
